tit.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 建学の精神
sen.e: Spirit of establishment
Spirit of establishment
Spirit of establishment

sen.j: 同志社の建学精神はキリスト教精神に基づく「良心」である。
sen.e: Spirit of establishment of Doshisha is 'conscience' which based on sprit of Christian.
Spirit of establishing Doshisha University is the 'conscience' based on the Christian spirit.
Spirit of establishing Doshisha University is the 'conscience' based on the Christian spirit.

sen.j: 新島襄は建学の目的として、「良心を手腕に運用する人物」の育成を掲げた。
sen.e: Joseph Hardy Neesima declared educating 'a person who manages things with ability of conscience' as a purpose of establishment.
Joseph Hardy Neesima declared that educating 'a person who can manage things in tune with his conscience' as the purpose of establishing Doshisha Univeristy.
Joseph Hardy Neesima (Jo NIIJIMA) declared that educating 'a person who can manage things in tune with his conscience' as the purpose of establishing Doshisha University.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 知識教育に偏ることのないよう、キリスト教に基づく「徳育」を並行して進めることで、「良心の全身に充満」した人々を輩出したいと願ったのである。
sen.e: He wished to educate people to have 'full of conscience in their whole body' with proceeded 'moral education' which based on the Christian without lean toward to the knowledge education.
He wished to educate people to be 'fully conscious ' of a 'moral education' based on Christian values without leaning toward an education based on just knowledge.
He wished to educate people to be 'fully conscious ' of a 'moral education' based on Christian values without leaning toward an education based on just knowledge.

sen.j: その思いを彼の筆跡のまま刻んだ碑が、今出川・京田辺両校地の正面入口に存在する。
sen.e: The monuments that carved his wish with his handwriting are in front of the gate in Imadegawa campus and Kyotanabe campus.
The monuments upon where his wishes are carved stand in front of the gates at both the Imadegawa campus and the Kyotanabe campus.
The monuments upon where his wishes are carved stand in front of the gates at both the Imadegawa campus and the Kyotanabe campus.

sen.j: この良心碑には、「良心之全身ニ充満シタル丈夫ノ起リ来ラン事ヲ」という言葉が刻まれている。
sen.e: The words are engraved on the monument of conscience as 'If your body is full of conscience everything will be fine'.
They say; 'If your mind has a conscience everything will be fine'.
On these monuments one can see the following words: "I earnestly desire that many young people filled with conscience will be raised and sent out by our school."
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: また、この「良心」教育を具体的に実現するための教育理念として、「キリスト教主義」「自由主義」「国際主義」が掲げられ、これらを通じて「一国の良心」たる人物を輩出することを目指している。
sen.e: Also it tries to educate people with 'the conscience of the country' through 'Christian principles', 'liberalism' and 'internationalism' as the philosophy of education to realized 'conscience' education specifically.

The purpose is to educate people to develop a 'country with a conscience' based upon 'Christian principles,' 'liberalism,' and 'internationalism' as the philosophy of education to specifically realized 'conscience' education.

The purpose is to educate people to develop a 'country with a conscience' based upon 'Christian principles,' 'liberalism,' and 'internationalism' as the philosophy of education to specifically realize 'conscience' education.

sen.j: 11学部12研究科を設置している。
sen.e: Established 11 facilities and 12 research courses.
Established 11 facilities and 12 research courses.
Doshisha University has 11 faculties and 12 graduate schools.
sen.cmt: facuties, graduate schools としました。

sen.j: また、日本国内には数少ない神学部を持つ。
sen.e: Also there is the Faculty of Theology which is rare in Japan.
Also there is the Faculty of Theology which is rare in Japan.
Also, it has the Faculty of Theology which is rare in Japan.

sen.j: キリスト教プロテスタント系の大学で、会衆派教会（組合教会）の流れをくむ。
sen.e: This is Christian Protestant university which characterized from the Congregationalist (Congregationalist).
This is Christian Protestant university characterized by the Congregationalist.
It is a Christian institution that is run based on the principles of Protestantism (Congregationalism).

sen.j: しかし、いわゆるミッション系大学とは性質が異なり、キリスト教伝道を主たる目的としない（教育そのものを伝道の手段としない）キリスト教主義大学である。
sen.e: But it is different from the University which called the Mission school, it doesn't mainly affirm the propagation of Christianity (education itself is not the propagation of Christianity), this is the Christian principles University.

But it is different from Universities that are called Mission schools, it does not mainly propagate Christianity (education itself is not for the propagation of Christianity), this is a univeristy based upon Christian principles.

But it is different from Universities that are called Mission schools, and it does not mainly propagate Christianity (education itself is not for the propagation of Christianity); this is a university based upon Christian principles.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 1875年、明治六大教育家の一人である新島襄により設立された同志社英学校を前身とする大学である。
sen.e: In 1875, Joseph Hardy Neesima, one of the 6 great educators of the Meiji era, established Doshisha English School, which grew to be the present Doshisha.
In 1875, Joseph Hardy Neesima, one of the 6 great educators euring the Meiji era, established Doshisha English School, that grew to become the present day Doshisha Universtiy.
In 1875, Joseph Hardy Neesima (Jo NIIJIMA), one of the six great educators during the Meiji period, established Doshisha English School, that grew to become the present day Doshisha University.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。スペルを修正しました。

tit.e: The time of Doshisha English School
The History of Doshisha English School
The History of Doshisha English School

sen.j: 1875年 新島襄が京都寺町に官許同志社英学校を開校する。
sen.e: 1875: Joseph Hardy Neesima (Jo NISHIJIMA) established Doshisha English School at Teramachi, Kyoto.
1875: Joseph Hardy Neesima (Jo NISHIJIMA) established Doshisha English School in Teramachi, Kyoto.
1875: Joseph Hardy Neesima (Jo NIIJIMA) established Doshisha English School in Teramachi, Kyoto.

sen.j: 教員2人、生徒8人。
sen.e: The number of teachers was 2, and students 8.
The number of teachers were 2, and students were 8.
The number of teachers was two, and that of students was eight.

sen.j: 1876年 今出川校地（旧薩摩藩邸跡）に移転。
sen.e: 1876: Campus was relocated to Imadegawa Campus (former residence of Satuma Domain).
1876: The campus was relocated to Imadegawa Campus (former residence of the Satuma Domain).

sen.j: 1887年 医学校（医学部）構想の一環として、同志社病院・京都看病婦学校を創設。
sen.e: 1887: Doshisha Hospital and Kyoto Training School for Nurses were established for a plan of medical school (the medical department).

sen.e: 1887: Doshisha Hospital and Kyoto Training School for Nurses were established to fulfill a plan to build a medical school (the medical department).
1887: Doshisha Hospital and Kyoto Training School for Nurses were established to fulfill a plan to build a medical school (the medical department).

sen.j: 同志社予備校設置。
sen.e: Established Doshisha Preparatory School.

sen.j: 1888年 同志社英学校と同志社予備校を併せて同志社学院（予備学部、普通学部、神学部）設置。
sen.e: 1888: Doshisha Gakuin (preliminary facility, the regular facility and the facility of theology) was established which merged Doshisha English School and Doshisha Preparatory School.
1888: Doshisha Gakuin (preliminary facility, the regular facility and the facility of theology) was established merging Doshisha English School and Doshisha Preparatory School.
1888: Doshisha Gakuin (preliminary facility, the regular facility and the facility of theology) was established merging Doshisha English School and Doshisha Preparatory School.

sen.j: 「同志社大学設立の旨意」を全国の主要な雑誌・新聞に発表。
sen.e: Intention of establishment of Doshisha University' was announced to main magazines and newspapers in the whole country.
The 'Intention to establishment of Doshisha University' was announced to the mainstream magazine and newspaper media throughout the whole country.
The 'Intention to establishment of Doshisha University' was announced to the mainstream magazine and newspaper media throughout the whole country.

sen.j: 1889年 同志社学院を同志社予備学校、同志社普通学校、同志社神学校と改称。
sen.e: 1889: Doshisha Gakuin was renamed Doshisha Preparatory School, and Doshisha Normal School was renamed to Doshisha Gakuin.

sen.j: 現在は、特定教派の牧師養成のみを目的とせず、一神教を中心に幅広く宗教を学べる学部となっている。
sen.e: Now, it's not a purpose to train clergyman for specified sect, it became the faculty that learn a sect widely with one base sect.
It no longer has the purpose to train clergyman for a particular sect, it has become a faculty that studies a wide variety of sects while adhering to one base sect.
It no longer has the purpose to train clergyman for a particular sect; it has become a faculty where students can study monotheism together with various religions.
sen.cmt: 一神教 →monotheism としました。

sen.j: キリスト教神学のみならず、ユダヤ教、イスラーム関連科目が設置されていることも特徴。
sen.e: It features that established courses which relate to Judaism and Islam, not only theology of Christian.
It features established courses related to Judaism and Islam, and not only Christian theology.
It not only has Christian theology courses but also those related to Judaism and Islam.

sen.j: 卒業後の進路は他学部と変わらず一般企業への就職が多い。
sen.e: The course after graduation is getting a job at general company which same as other faculty.
After graduation the next step is getting a job at general company which is same goal as with other faculties.
After graduating the School of Theology many students find jobs at general, private-sector companies, in a similar way as students of other departments.

sen.j: 1904年に専門学校令によって各専門学校が統合され同志社政法学校は廃校し、同志社専門学校が開校する。
sen.e: Doshisha School of Law and Politics were abolished because each professional school was merged by Act of Colleges in 1904, and the Doshisha Technical School was established.

sen.j: 1912年に専門学校令によって同志社大学が開校され政治経済学部ができる。
sen.e: Doshisha University was established by Acts of Colleges in 1912, and Faculty of Politics and Economics was established.

sen.e: Doshisha University was established in compliance with the Acts of Colleges in 1912, and Faculty of Politics and Economics was established.
Doshisha University was established in compliance with the Acts of Colleges in 1912, and Faculty of Politics and Economics was established.

sen.j: 1920年には大学令によって同志社大学が開校され、法学部政治学科として誕生する。
sen.e: Doshisha University was opened by Acts of Colleges in 1920, and Department of Political Science, Faculty of Law was established.

sen.j: 1922年には専門学校令による大学を同志社専門学校とし、政治経済部が置かれる。
sen.e: The University became as Doshisha Technical School by Acts of Colleges in 1922, and Faculty of Politics and Economics was established.
sen.cmt: 同志社専門学校→Doshisha Technical School[定訳不明]専門学校令→Acts of Colleges[http://www.cis.doshisha.ac.jp/kkitao/doshisha/chronology.htm ]政治経済部→Faculty of Politics and Economics[定訳不明]
sen.e: The University became Doshisha Technical School in compliance with the Acts of Colleges in 1922, and Faculty of Politics and Economics was established.

sen.j: 1944年に同志社専門学校高等英語部と法律経済部を統合され同志社外事専門学校が設置される。
sen.e: English department of Doshisha Technical School and Department of Law and Economics were merged, and established Doshisha Technical School of Foreign Affairs in 1944.
sen.cmt: 同志社専門学校→Doshisha Technical School[定訳不明]同志社外事専門学校→Doshisha Technical School of Foreign Affairs [定訳不明]
sen.e: The English department of Doshisha Technical School and Department of Law and Economics were merged together, and the Doshisha Technical School of Foreign Affairs was established in 1944.
The Higher English Department of Doshisha Technical School and Department of Law and Economics were merged together, and the Doshisha Technical School of Foreign Affairs was established in 1944.

sen.j: また、同年に大学令による同志社大学は再編成され、法文学部政経学科になる。
sen.e: And, Doshisha university was reorganized by Acts of Colleges in same year, and became Department of Politics and Economics, Faculty of Letters.
sen.cmt: 同志社大学→Doshisha University法文学部政経学科→Department of Politics and Economics, Faculty of Law and Letters[定訳不明]法文学部→Faculty of Law and Letters[定訳不明]文学部→Faculty of Letters[http://www.doshisha.ac.jp/english/faculties/undergraduate/letters/ ]政経学科→Department of Politics and Economics[定訳不明]
sen.e: And, Doshisha university was reorganized in accordance with the Acts of Colleges in same year, and became the Department of Politics and Economics, Faculty of Letters.

Also, Doshisha University was reorganized in accordance with the Acts of Colleges in the same year, and the above technical school became the Department of Politics and Economics, Faculty of Law and Letters.

sen.j: 2年後の1946年には元の学部編成に戻り、法学部政治学科、法律学科に戻る。
sen.e: Two years later in 1946, arrangement of faculty was returned to original, and became department of Political Science, Faculty of Law, and Department of Law.

Two years later in 1946, the faculty was returned to its original structure, and became the Department of Political Science and Department of Law within the Faculty of Law.

sen.j: そしてそして1949年に同志社外事専門学校は同志社大学に吸収、1952年に専門学校は廃止され、同志社で政治、法律を学ぶところが一本化される。
sen.e: And, Doshisha Technical School of Foreign Affairs was merged to Doshisha University, and the Technical School was abolished in 1952, and it was centralized to the place to learn politics and law to Doshisha.

sen.j: 機械工学科を機械システム工学科、機械工学第二学科をエネルギー機械工学科、工業化学科を機能分子工学科、化学工学科を物質化学工学科に改組。
sen.e: Department of Mechanical Engineering, Department of the Second Mechanical Engineering, Department of Industrial Chemical, and, Department of Chemical Engineering were respectively reorganized into Department of Mechanical and Systems Engineering, Department of Energy and Mechanical Engineering, Department of Molecular Science and Technology, and Department of Chemical Engineering and Material.

sen.j: また、私学だけで見ても合格率は35.0%なので合格率はあまり高くはない。

sen.e: Summary
Summary

sen.j: 同志社の図書館の歴史は1876年に図書縦覧室を設け、創立者である新島襄が自らの書籍を公開、貸し出ししたことが始まりである。
sen.e: The history of Doshisha's library began in 1876 when a reading room was established and Joseph hardy Neesima (Joe NIIJIMA), the founder of the university, opened his collection of books to the students in order to lend them.

The history of Doshisha's library began in 1876 when a reading room was established and Joseph hardy Neesima (Joe NIIJIMA), the founder of the university, opened his collection of books to the students in order to lend them out.

The history of Doshisha's library began in 1876 when a reading room was established and Joseph hardy Neesima (Joe NIIJIMA), the founder of the university, opened his collection of books to the students in order to lend them out.

sen.j: 1887年に初代図書館（現有終館）が完成。
sen.e: The first library (Yusyukan) was completed in 1887.
The first library (Yusyukan) was completed in 1887.
The first library (Yusyukan) was completed in 1887.

sen.j: 当時この図書館は日本で最大であった。
sen.e: The library was the biggest library in Japan at that time.
The library was the biggest library in Japan at that time.
The library was the biggest library in Japan at that time.

sen.j: 1915年に2代目図書館（現啓明館西館）が完成。
sen.e: The second library (at present Keimeikan south building) was completed in 1915.
The second library (at present Keimeikan south building) was completed in 1915.
The second library (present Keimeikan south building) was completed in 1915.

sen.j: 1920年に現在の啓明館本館が完成した。
sen.e: The present main building of Keimeikan was completed in 1920.
The present main building of the Keimeikan was completed in 1920.
The present main building of the Keimeikan was completed in 1920.

sen.j: 1973年に現在の今出川図書館が完成。
sen.e: The present Imadegawa Library was completed in 1973.
The present Imadegawa Library was completed in 1973.
The present Imadegawa Library was completed in 1973.

sen.j: 1986年に京田辺校地開校に伴いラーネッド記念図書館が完成。

sen.j: 1876年 図書縦覧室を設け、創立者である新島襄が自らの書籍を公開、貸し出しを開始。

sen.j: 1912年 図書館の教室への転用のためさらに分置が進む。

sen.j: 1918年 同志社職制が制定され、館長と司書をおくことが定められる。

sen.e: In 2006, 'Project Class' was organized as liberal arts education common for all grades, which was a practical and student-centered class, being different from the conventional style of classes in which students did desk study.

sen.j: 地域社会や企業と連携し、学生に生きた智恵や技術を学ばせるとと現場に学ぶ視点を育み、問題の「所在」と「解決」を考え抜く力を陶冶することを目的としている。
sen.e: The purpose of this class was to have the students learn real intelligence and arts, and also cultivate the idea of emphasizing what is happening on the ground, training the ability to think over 'where' the problem is and 'how' it is solved.

The purpose of this class was to have the students learn real intelligence and arts, and also cultivate ideas of what was happening on the ground, training the ability to think of 'where' the problem is and 'how' it is solved.

sen.j: 江湖館（こうこかん）という町屋一軒だけのキャンパスではあるが、総合政策科学研究科や、2007年度に採択された社会人の学び直しニーズ対応教育推進事業のソーシャル・イノベーション型再チャレンジ支援教育プログラムなど幅広く活用されている。
sen.e: Although the campus consists of one building of Machiya (a traditional form of townhouse found mainly in Kyoto) called Kokokan, it is widely used by Graduate School of Policy and Management and the re-challenge support program for social innovation which was adopted as Education Promotion Program Responding to Working Adults' Needs for Re-learning in 2007.

sen.j: 今出川校地は旧薩摩藩邸の跡地で、隣接して冷泉家、南に京都御所、北に相国寺がある。
sen.e: Imadegawa Campus was built on the site where the old residence of the Satsuma domain once stood, and there are the residence of the Reizei family next to it, Kyoto Imperial Palace to the south, and Sokoku-ji Temple to the north.

Imadegawa Campus was built on the site where the old residence of the Satsuma domain once stood, as well as the the residence of the Reizei family which stood next to it, the Kyoto Imperial Palace to the south, and Sokoku-ji Temple to the north.

sen.j: 今出川・新町・室町の3校地は近接しており、ほぼ一体として利用されており、3校地を併せて今出川校地と呼ぶことが多い。

sen.j: 同志社大学の前身である、同志社英学校時代からある校地である。
sen.e: The campus is existed when there was the Doshisha English School which Doshisha University grew to be.
The campus existed when there was just the Doshisha English School that later grew to become Doshisha University.

sen.j: 同志社英学校が1875年11月29日に開校した時には京都市上京区寺町丸太町上ルの高松保実の屋敷（現在は新島旧邸）の一角を借り、教室として寄宿舎として利用していた。
sen.e: On November 29, 1875, when Doshisha English School opened, it rented a part of the Sasuzane TAKAMATSU's residence (the former residence of Nijima now), Teramachi Marutamachi agaru, Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City, and it was used as a classroom and a dormitory.

On November 29, 1875, when Doshisha English School opened, it rented a part of the Sasuzane TAKAMATSU's residence (the former residence of Nijima now), Teramachi Marutamachi agaru, Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City, and it was used as a classroom and a dormitory.

On November 29, 1875, when Doshisha English School opened, it rented a part of the Sasuzane TAKAMATSU's residence (the former residence of Niijima now), Teramachi Marutamachi agaru, Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City, and it was used as a classroom and a dormitory.

sen.j: そのおよそ半年後に購入してあった土地、現在の今出川に建物ができたので学校を移す。
sen.e: After about half a year, the building was completed on the land which had already been purchased, the present Imadegawa, so the school was relocated.

sen.j: 当初は2棟（第一寮､第二寮）の建物で1階を教室、2階を寄宿舎として使用していた。
sen.e: At the time, there were 2 buildings (the first dormitory, the second dormitory) and these were used as classroom at first floor and dormitory at second floor.
At the time, there were 2 buildings (the first dormitory, the second dormitory) and these were used as classrooms on the first floor and as a dormitory on second floor.
At the time, there were two buildings (the first dormitory, the second dormitory) and these were used as classrooms on the first floor and as a dormitory on second floor.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: また、同志社はキリスト教主義であるが、当時の京都ではキリスト教を排除する傾向にあり、住民の反対運動が相次いだ。
sen.e: Although the Doshisha was established based on Christian doctrine, there was a tendency to eliminate Christian in Kyoto at that time, so local residents' campaigns against Doshisha happened one after another.
Although the Doshisha was established based on Christian doctrine, Christians were being eliminated in Kyoto at the time, so there were continous campaigns against the Doshisha by local residents.
Although the Doshisha was established based on Christian doctrine, Christians were being eliminated in Kyoto at the time, so there were continuous campaigns against the Doshisha by local residents.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: そのため、今出川校地において教育を行う際に聖書を教えてはいけないとの契約を京都府とも結んでいた。
sen.e: That is why the university made a contract with Kyoto Prefecture not to teach the Bible during the classes on the Imadegawa Campus.
Which is why the university made a contract with Kyoto Prefecture not to teach the Bible during classes on the Imadegawa Campus.
Which is why the university made a contract with Kyoto Prefecture not to teach the Bible during classes on the Imadegawa Campus.

sen.j: そこで新島襄は現在のアーモスト館あたりにあった元豆腐屋を新島名義で買い上げ、学校外のその場所で聖書を教えることとなった。
sen.e: Joseph Hardy Neesima (NIIJIMA Jo) purchased former tofu store which was around current Amherst House under Niijima's name, and taught the bible at that place which was outside of the school.

sen.j: しかし、実際には学校内で聖書を教えていたところを京都府の役員に発見されて新島が始末書を書いたこともある。
sen.e: But actually the officer of Kyoto prefecture found that teaching the bible in the school, and Nishijima had to write an apology letter.
But actually the officer of Kyoto prefecture discovered the teaching of the bible at the school, and Nishijima had to write a letter of apology.
However, in fact the officer of Kyoto Prefecture discovered the teaching of the bible at the school, and Niijima had to write a letter of apology.

sen.j: レンガ造りの建物がほとんどを占める同志社の建物だが最初に建てられたものは木造で、同志社に初めて登場するレンガ造りの建物は1884年に完成したアメリカン・ボードより寄付された彰栄館（京都で現存する最古のレンガ造り）である。
sen.e: The most of buildings of Doshisha are built of brick but the first building was made by wood, the first brick building was Shoeikan (the oldest brick building that exist in Kyoto) which was completed in 1884 that was donated from American Board.

sen.e: There are some tasks under consideration, for example, relocation of the humanities faculties for the freshmen and sophomores from Kyotanabe Campus to Imadegawa Campus, establishment of Faculty of Psychology on Kyotanabe Campus in accordance with the reform of Department of Psychology in the Faculty of Letters, and so on.

sen.cmt: first year, second year として統一しました。

sen.j: 京田辺校地建設に伴い近鉄京都線興戸駅から大学に向かう通学路を建設したが、その通学路を通るより住宅街を通り抜ける方が距離的に近く、同志社前駅の上の高架橋を通ることなく通学できるため、多くの学生がその通学路を通っていない。
sen.e: When Kyotanabe Campus was built, school-commuting roads were also made from the Kodo Station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line to the university, but it takes less time to go through the residential streets rather than go along the school-commuting roads, and the students do not have to cross the elevated bridge above the Doshisha mae Station, so many students do not use the school-commuting roads.

When Kyotanabe Campus was built, school roads were also made from the Kodo Station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line to the university, but it takes less time to go through the residential streets rather than going along the school roads, and the students do not have to cross the elevated bridge above the Doshisha mae Station, so many students do not use the school roads.

When Kyotanabe Campus was built, school roads were also made from the Kodo Station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line to the university, but it takes less time to go through the residential streets rather than going along the school roads, and the students do not have to cross the elevated bridge above the Doshishamae Station, so many students do not use the school roads.

sen.j: またその問題を毎日放送のVOICE (ニュース)にて放送された。
sen.e: The problem was televised on the Voice of Mainichi broadcasting (news).
The problem was televised on the Voice of Mainichi broadcasting (news).
The problem was televised on the Voice of Mainichi broadcasting (news).

sen.j: 今出川校地が年々手狭になり、大学設置基準を満たすためにも学校法人同志社として京田辺市（当時田辺町）に土地を購入した。
sen.e: It purchased the land in Kyotanabe City (Tanabe-cho in those days) as The Doshisha to satisfy the standard of establishment of university because Imadegawa Campus was getting small each year.
Land was purchased in Kyotanabe City (Tanabe-cho in those days) for The Doshisha to satisfy the standard of establishing a university because Imadegawa Campus was getting more crowded each year.
Land was purchased in Kyotanabe City (Tanabe-cho in those days) by the Doshisha to satisfy the university establishment standards because Imadegawa Campus was getting more crowded each year.
sen.cmt: 大学設置基準→university establishment standards としました。

sen.j: 1965年8月14日に同志社理事会において「田辺校地に関する基本方針」が承認され、1965年8月25日に校地拡張委員会、1965年12月4日には田辺用地専門委員会が組織された。
sen.e: The basic plan regarding to Tanabe Campus' was approved by board of directors of Doshisha in August 14, 1965, and the committee of extension of school land was organized in August 25, 1965, and the professional committee of the land for Tanabe was organized in December 4, 1965.

The basic plan regarding Tanabe Campus' was approved by the board of directors of Doshisha in August 14, 1965, and the committee for the extension of school land was organized in August 25, 1965, and the professional committee of the land for Tanabe was organized in December 4, 1965.

The basic plan regarding Tanabe Campus' was approved by the board of directors of Doshisha on August 14, 1965, and the committee for campus expansion was organized on August 25, 1965, and the professional committee of the land in Tanabe was organized on December 4, 1965.

sen.j: そして翌年の1966年9月7日に近畿日本鉄道と土地売買契約を交わし、その翌年の1987年にも土地を買収した。
sen.e: On September 7 of the following 1966, the university made a land contract with Kinki Nippon Railway Company, and it also purchased land the next year, 1987.
On September 7 of the following 1966, the university made a land contract with Kinki Nippon Railway Company, and also purchased land the next year in 1987.
On September 7 of the following 1966, the university made a land contract with Kinki Nippon Railway Company, and also purchased land the next year in 1967.
sen.cmt: 原文では1987となっていますが、1967ではないかと解釈しました。

sen.j: 一次買収では約47万平方メートルで、2次買収とあわせると約100万平方メートルを買収した。
sen.e: The university first purchased the land of approximately 470,000 square meters, and together with the second purchase, it got the land of approximately 1000,000 square meters in total.
The university first purchased an area approximately 470,000 square meters, and together with their second purchase, the land purchased totaled approximately 1000,000 square meters.
The university first purchased an area approximately 470,000 square meters, and together with their second purchase, the land purchased totaled approximately 1000,000 square meters.

sen.j: 買収した20年後の1986年3月27日に同志社女子大学と合同で同志社女子大学恵真館に於いて竣工式が行われた。
sen.e: Twenty years after the purchase, on March 27, 1986, a ceremony for the completion was held together with Doshisha Women's College of Liberal Arts at Keishinkan of Doshisha Women's College of Liberal Arts.

sen.j: 同志社大学の学生寮は、居住する学生自身によって管理・運営される点が大きな特徴である。
sen.e: The big feature of the student dormitory of Doshisha University is that it is managed and run by the students who live there.

The big feature of the student dormitory of Doshisha University is that it is managed and run by the students who live there.

sen.j: あくまで学生の自主管理であるため、大学が広範に管理を行う一般的な学生寮のイメージとは異なっている。
sen.e: It is different from the typical image of dormitory which university manages comprehensively because of the self-management by the students.

sen.j: 同志社大学ではこうした学生が自主管理を行う考え方を「自治理念」と呼んでいる。
sen.e: Doshisha University calls the idea of self-management by the students 'philosophy of autonomy.'
Doshisha University calls the idea of self-management by the students 'philosophy of autonomy.'
Doshisha University calls the idea of self-management by the students 'philosophy of autonomy.'

sen.j: 「自治理念」とは、土地や建物は大学の施設であるものの、その管理・運営は、居住する寮生自身によって行うという考え方である。
sen.e: Philosophy of autonomy' is the idea that students who live in the dormitory manage and run the place even though the land and building belong to the university.
Philosophy of autonomy' is the idea that students who live in the dormitory manage and run the place even though the land and building belong to the university.

sen.j: 実際、寮の管理・運営における大学との関係においては、自治精神を重視し、一定の緊張感を保った交渉を行っている。
sen.e: Actually, the relationship with the university in the management of dormitory keeps certain tension, and they take the spirit of autonomy seriously while negotiating.

sen.j: 同志社大学内では「自治理念」に基づいた寮であるため、学生寮のことを「自治寮」と呼んでいる。
sen.e: The dormitory is based on 'philosophy of autonomy,' so it is called 'autonomy dormitory' in Doshisha University.
The dormitory is based on 'philosophy of autonomy,' so it is called an 'autonomous dormitory' in Doshisha University.

sen.j: 「自治寮」という考え方については、学生運動の流れを汲んでいる。
sen.e: The idea of 'autonomy dormitory' came from a student movement.
The idea of an 'autonomous dormitory came from a student movement.
The idea of an 'autonomous dormitory came from a student movement.

sen.j: 昭和の学生運動が盛んなころ、日本全国の大学には、自主独立の気運が存在、同志社大学の学生寮においてもこのような理念が創出され、自治を重んじる風潮が生まれた。
sen.e: Around the period when the student movement in the Showa era flourished, there was a tendency toward sovereign independence among the Japanese universities, and at the Doshisha University dormitory such ideology was born, creating a trend to take the idea of autonomy seriously.

Around the period when the student movement in the Showa era flourished, there was a tendency toward sovereign independence among the Japanese universities, and at the Doshisha University dormitory such an ideology was born, thus creating the trend which took the idea of gaining autonomy seriously.

sen.j: 同志社大学の学生が政治・経済・文化の中心である東京で、また早稲田大学学生が日本の文化や歴史を誇る京都で、異なる地域・風土で学び、視野を広げ、個性を磨くことを目的として行われる。
sen.e: This is for the purpose of opening a new horizon to the students through a study in different areas and climates, and developing their personality: Doshisha University students study at Tokyo, which is the center of politics, economy, and culture, while Waseda University students at Kyoto, which takes pride in Japanese traditional culture and history.

sen.j: 協力団体として、高野山大学密教文化研究所、国際真宗学会、宗教倫理学会、種智院大学密教資料研究所、同志社大学一神教学際研究センター、南山宗教文化研究所、NCC宗教研究所、日本クリスチャンアカデミー、龍谷大学仏教文化研究所が加盟。
sen.e: Koyasan University Tantric Buddhist Culture, International Association of Shin Buddhist Studies, Japan Association of Religion and Ethics, Research Institute the Materials of Esoteric Buddhism, Shuchiin University, Doshisha University Center for Interdisciplinary Study of Monotheistic Religions, anzan Institute for Religion and Culture, NCC Center for the Study of Japanese Religions, Nippon Christian Academy and Ryukoku University Research Institute for Buddhist Culture are affiliated as a cooperation group.

sen.e: Koyasan University Tantric Buddhist Culture, International Association of Shin Buddhist Studies, Japan Association of Religion and Ethics, Research Institute of the Materials of Esoteric Buddhism, Shuchiin University, Doshisha University Center for Interdisciplinary Study of Monotheistic Religions, Nanzan Institute for Religion and Culture, NCC Center for the Study of Japanese Religions, Nippon Christian Academy and Ryukoku University Research Institute for Buddhist Culture are all affiliated as a cooperation group.

sen.j: 群馬県にある新島学園中学校・高等学校は、同志社の創立者である新島襄の理念に共感した湯浅正次（有田屋当主）が、その理念を元に設立した学校で、理念は共有しているが、新島学園中学校・高等学校を同志社が設立したなどといった関係ではない。
sen.e: Niijima Gakuen Junior & Senior High School in Gunma Prefecture was established by Shoji YUASA (the family head of Aritaya), who sympathized the philosophy of the founder of the Doshisha, Joseph Hardy Neesima (Jo NIIJIMA), on the basis of the philosophy, however, it does not mean that the Doshisha established Niijima Gakuen Junior & Senior High School though the school shares the same philosophy.
sen.cmt: 新島襄→Joseph Hardy Neesima （NIIJIMA Jo）[http://www.doshisha.ac.jp/english/information/overview/chronology.php ]新島学園中学校・高等学校→Niijima Gakuen Junior & Senior High School[http://namesv.neesima.ac.jp/02chukotop.html ]
sen.e: Niijima Gakuen Junior & Senior High School in Gunma Prefecture was established by Shoji YUASA (the family head of Aritaya), who sympathized the philosophy of the founder of the Doshisha, Joseph Hardy Neesima (Jo NIIJIMA), on the basis of the philosophy, however, it does not mean that the Doshisha established Niijima Gakuen Junior & Senior High School though the school shares the same philosophy.

Niijima Gakuen Junior & Senior High School in Gunma Prefecture was established by Shoji YUASA (the family head of Aritaya), who sympathized the philosophy of the founder of the Doshisha, Joseph Hardy Neesima (Jo NIIJIMA), on the basis of the philosophy, however, it does not mean that the Doshisha established Niijima Gakuen Junior & Senior High School although the school shares the same philosophy.

sen.j: しかし、同志社大学への推薦枠を持ち、中学校・高等学校間で交流が行われているため、便宜上、ここにまとめる。
sen.e: However, the school has quotas for recommendation to Doshisha University, and the Junior & Senior High Schools mingle with the university, so it was written here for reference.
However, the school has quotas for recommendation to Doshisha University, and the Junior & Senior High Schools mingle with the university, so it was written here for reference.

sen.j: JR福知山線脱線事故
sen.e: JR Fukuchiyama Line Derailing accident
JR Fukuchiyama Line Derailing accident
JR Fukuchiyama Line Derailing accident

sen.j: 大学の2限に出席するために多くの学生が乗車しており、3名の学生が亡くなり、34人の学生が負傷するという事故が起きた。
sen.e: Many students were on the train to attend the classes in the second period, then the accident occurred: 3 students were killed and 34 students were injured.
Many students were on the train to attend classes in the second period, when the accident occurred: 3 students were killed and 34 students were injured.
Many students were on the train to attend classes in the second period, when the accident occurred: 3 students were killed and 34 students were injured.

sen.j: 被害が拡大した要因の一つとして同志社前駅の構造（詳細は同志社前駅）が問題視されている。
sen.e: One of the factors which increased the damage was the structure of Doshishamae Station, which is regarded as problematic (see the section of Doshishamae Station for further details).
One of the factors which increased the damage was the structure of Doshishamae Station, which was regarded as problematic (see the section of Doshishamae Station for further details).
One of the factors which increased the damage was the structure of Doshishamae Station, which was regarded as problematic (see the section of Doshishamae Station for further details).

sen.j: 構造形式煉瓦造、建築面積316.0㎡、一階建、一部中二階及び地下室付、鉄板葺

sen.e: American Gothic brick building with an iron roof.

sen.j: アメリカン・ボードの寄付によって建築。
sen.e: It was built by the donation from American Board.

sen.j: 日本におけるプロテスタント派の煉瓦造りの礼拝堂としては現存する最古のもの。
sen.e: It is the most old brick chapel of Protestant which exist in Japan.
It is the oldest Protestant brick chapel existing in Japan.
It is the oldest Protestant brick chapel existing in Japan.

sen.j: 施工は有終館も請け負った三上吉兵衛。
sen.e: Constructed by Kichibei MIKAMI who contracted Yushukan.

sen.j: ステンドグラスが美しく、徳冨蘆花の小説、黒い眼と茶色の目の中で「五色の光線」が降ると形容された。
sen.e: It was described that 'five colors lighting are falling' in "Black eyes and brown eyes" which is the novel by Roka TOKUTOMI, because the stained glass was beautiful.
It was described that 'five colors of light are falling' in "Black and brown eyes" which is a novel by Roka TOKUTOMI, because the stained glass was beautiful.

sen.j: 1963年に国の重要文化財に指定され、1987年から1990年まで半解体修理工事が行われた。
sen.e: It was specified the important cultural property in 1963, and construction for renovation was done from 1987 to 1990.
It was specified an important cultural property in 1963, and renovation was done from 1987 to 1990.

sen.j: 現在も礼拝堂として使用されており、毎週礼拝も行われている。
sen.e: Currently it is utilized as the chapel, the worship is open every week.

sen.j: また、週末には同志社関係者に限り結婚式を挙げることもできる。
sen.e: Also it is able to have a wedding ceremony for only people related to the Doshisha on the weekend.

Also it is possible for those people related to Doshisha to have a wedding ceremony on the weekend.

sen.j: 同志社の礼拝堂としては2代目(初代は木造)。

sen.j: 石敷き遺構 (室町校地)
sen.e: Cobble stone artifact (Muromachi Campus)
Cobble stone artifact (Muromachi Campus)
Cobble stone artifact (Muromachi Campus)

sen.j: 2002年の寒梅館の建設に伴う発掘調査にて発見された。
sen.e: It was discovered at excavation research of establishment of Kanbaikan.
It was discovered during excavation research about the establishment of Kanbaikan.
It was discovered in 2002 during excavation research prior to the construction of Kambaikan.
sen.cmt: Kambaikan としました。2002を追加しました。

sen.j: 石敷きの中から16世紀中頃の土器が出土した。
sen.e: An unglazed earthenware from 16th century was discovered inside of cobble stone.
An unglazed earthenware from the 16th century was discovered inside a cobble stone.
An unglazed earthenware from the 16th century was discovered in the cobble stones.

sen.j: 洛中洛外図により、寒梅館周辺は第12代将軍足利義晴が再築した花の御所のあった場所と推定され、出土したものと、洛中洛外図が一致するため、この石敷きは花の御所の北東隅の社とその南の築地基礎と推定される。
sen.e: It was assumed that the area around Kanbaikan used to be Hanano no gosho (Palace of Flowers) which the 12th general Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA rebuilt. This cobble stone is assumed that the building at corner of north east, and base of a tile-roofed mud wall at south at Hanano gosho (Palace of Flowers) because the things that discovered and Rakuchu Rakugai-zu were matched.
sen.cmt: 洛中洛外図→Rakuchu Rakugai-zu[定訳不明]花の御所→Hana no gosho （Palace of Flowers）[定訳不明]
sen.e: It was assumed that the area around Kanbaikan used to be Hanano no gosho (Palace of Flowers) which the 12th general Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA rebuilt. This cobble stone is assumed from the building atthe corner of north east, and base of a tile-roofed mud wall at south at Hanano gosho (Palace of Flowers) because the things that discovered and Rakuchu Rakugai-zu were matched.

It was assumed that the area around Kambaikan used to be Hana no gosho (Palace of Flowers) which the 12th Shogun Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA rebuilt according to Rakuchu Rakugai-zu (painting of Kyoto and its surroundings); these cobble stones are assumed to be the groundwork for the building at the northeast corner and the tile-roofed mud wall at its south because the things discovered and Rakuchu Rakugai-zu match.
sen.cmt: 一部修正しました。"shogun" -> "Shogun" に変更しました。

sen.j: 現在は寒梅館にて一部発掘したままの状態を見ることができるようになっている。
sen.e: At present, it is able to see the part of discovery with same condition as when it was discovered at Kanbaikan.
At present, can see part of discovery under the same condition as when it was discovered at Kanbaikan.
At present, one can see part of the discovery under the same condition as when it was discovered at Kambaikan.

sen.j: この足跡は、アメリカ合衆国のニューイングランド、コネチカット州の渓谷から出たもので「時の砂に押し残された足跡」と記されている。

sen.j: 有史前の足跡は「新世界」からアジアの「旧世界」へと学校法人同志社とアマースト大学、アメリカ合衆国と日本の長い絆を想起させるものとして贈られてきたものである。
sen.e: Prehistoric foot print was presented as imagination of the long ties which is from 'new world' to 'old world' of Asia between The Doshisha and Amherst University, and United States of America and Japan.

Prehistoric foot print was presented as imagination of the long ties from the 'new world' to the 'old world' of Asia between The Doshisha and Amherst University, and the United States of America and Japan.

sen.j: 3位になった主な理由として圧倒的なボリュームの統計データや、Cyber学長室、同志社クイズに見られる特徴的なコンテンツが評価された。

The overwhelming volume of statistical data, and characteristic contents such as the cyber president room and Doshisha quiz were the main reasons for winning the third place.

sen.j: ウェブサイトの使いやすさで20位、情報公開度・先進性で2位。
